sentences.english: The people working here tonight have no beef with the picket line .
sentences.chinese: 今晚在這裏上工的人與遊行罷工的人並無芥蒂。

sentences.english: Once you love who you are, you will be totally free to love others.
sentences.chinese: 一旦愛上自己，你將能毫無芥蒂地愛上別人。

sentences.english: Yet it is also not hard to see why the outside world was uncertain about the revolutionaries.
sentences.chinese: 同樣不難發現的是，爲何外界對革命者始終心存芥蒂。

sentences.english: Why do you still have a clip on your shouder ?
sentences.chinese: 你爲什麼還是心存芥蒂呢？

sentences.english: Two people who trust telling their secrets to each other feel safe.
sentences.chinese: 兩個人可以毫無芥蒂地聊隱私的人能感到安全感。

sentences.english: Pro-business voters cannot be ignored, and they have doubts about both candidates.
sentences.chinese: 重商的選民不容忽視，但他們對兩位候選都心存芥蒂。

sentences.english: I'm just always suspicious of new people.
sentences.chinese: 我只不過總是對陌生人心存芥蒂。

sentences.english: The Russian ambassador assured me we have no daylight between us.
sentences.chinese: 俄羅斯特使也向我保證，我們之間毫無芥蒂。

sentences.english: Southeast Asian nations also distrust one another.
sentences.chinese: 南亞諸國相互之間也是芥蒂甚深。

sentences.english: Any bad blood between co-workers can really cause problems.
sentences.chinese: 同事間心存芥蒂真的會引發一些問題。

sentences.english: South Koreans tend to be suspicious of people they don't know.
sentences.chinese: 韓國人對陌生人會心存芥蒂。

definition: an old grudge/old scores to settle
a matter that gnaws at one's mind/preoccupation/sore point/rancor
